SENT.plain: The aim of the present study was to describe a case of Behçet's disease revealed by a recurrent meningitis and to review literature on these two conditions
We describe the case of a 25-year-old man who presented four episodes of recurrent meningitis without any locoregional cause and developed oral and genital ulcerations few months later
Behçet's disease is a chronic, multisystemic disorder with variable prevalence in different geographical areas
Its neurological manifestations are well recognized
Both central and peripheral nervous systems can be involved
Recurrent meningitis in Behçet's disease is exceptional
To our knowledge, only two cases reported recurrent meningitis as initial manifestation of Behçet's disease
This case report underscores another facet of neurological manifestations of Behçet's disease
